summary: The bill, titled the Protecting Pharmacies in Medicaid Act, aims to ensure accurate payments to pharmacies under Medicaid and prevent abusive spread pricing practices. It mandates the Secretary of Health and Human Services to conduct surveys to determine national average drug acquisition costs, establishes penalties for non-compliant pharmacies, and requires transparent pass-through pricing models for prescription drugs. The bill also includes oversight provisions by the Inspector General and modifies definitions related to pharmacies and pharmacy benefit managers.
